item.title: 气候空头：对冲基金大举押注绿色未来
item.description: 这个价值 5 万亿美元的产业反对清洁能源和绿色技术的举动，可能比 "觉醒 "资本主义的政治反弹更具破坏性。【原文：The $5 trillion industry's move against clean energy and green technology may prove more damaging than political pushback over “woke” capitalism.】

item.title: 飓风 "奥斯卡 "令古巴雪上加霜，全国大停电
item.description: 古巴将在未来三天暂停非必要活动和学校活动，以抵御全国大停电和飓风奥斯卡的双重威胁。【原文：Cuba is suspending nonessential activities and school for the next three days as its fends off the twin threats of a grinding national blackout and Hurricane Oscar.】

item.title: 飓风奥斯卡以 1 级风暴登陆巴哈马群岛
item.description: 美国国家飓风中心称，飓风奥斯卡在巴哈马大伊纳瓜岛登陆，预计将于周日下午袭击古巴东部。【原文：Hurricane Oscar made landfall on Great Inagua Island in the Bahamas and is forecast to strike in eastern Cuba on Sunday afternoon, the US National Hurricane Center said.】

item.title: 意大利中北部遭受洪灾，暴雨后道路关闭
item.description: 连日暴雨导致河流泛滥，洪水席卷了意大利中北部部分地区，促使国家主导的公路运营商关闭了一些高速公路。【原文：Floods engulfed parts of north-central Italy from overflowing rivers following days of heavy rain, prompting the state-led road operator to close some expressways.】

item.title: 新加坡壳牌输油管周日早些时候报告漏油
item.description: 新加坡说，它在周日早些时候接到了壳牌陆上输油管漏油的警报，并已采取措施清理漏油。【原文：Singapore said it was alerted to an oil leakage from a Shell land-based pipeline early Sunday, and steps have been taken to clean up the spill.】

item.title: 阿什利风暴来袭，大风大雨导致英国旅行中断
item.description: 由于大风和暴雨袭击英国，风暴 "阿什利 "已造成旅行中断。【原文：Storm Ashley has caused travel disruption as high winds and rain batter the UK.】

item.title: 瑞银银行家迫于律师压力反思 ESG 标签
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）正在要求其银行家们重新考虑他们在公开场合讨论某些可持续产品的方式。【原文：UBS Group AG is asking its bankers to rethink the way they discuss some sustainable products in public following advice from its lawyers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 对 COP16 的期待
item.description: 随着各国、投资者和贷款人开始齐聚哥伦比亚的联合国生物多样性峰会，今天的新闻通讯将为您提供有关预期的信息。阅读和分享本篇报道，并随时关注彭博社网站上有关谈判的所有新闻。【原文：As countries, investors and lenders begin to gather at the UN biodiversity summit in Colombia, today’s newsletter gives you an idea of what to expect. Read and share this story and keep up with all of the news from the negotiations at Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 自然 "盗版 "和资金之争将主导联合国生物多样性峰会
item.description:
各国、投资者和贷款人齐聚哥伦比亚第十六届缔约方大会，试图扭转全球生物圈衰退的趋势。【原文：

Countries, investors and lenders have gathered at COP16 in Colombia to try to reverse the global decline of the biosphere. 

】

item.title: 阿什利风暴来袭，天气警告已生效
item.description: 由于英国部分地区受到风暴 "阿什利 "的袭击，风雨警告已经生效。【原文：Warnings for wind and rain have come into effect as parts of the UK are hit by Storm Ashley.】

item.title: 卢拉承诺政府将为圣保罗停电事故受害者提供帮助
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）表示，政府将帮助因暴雨导致圣保罗停电的受害者，并承诺向停电超过 24 小时的企业和居民提供援助。【原文：Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said the government would help victims of blackouts that have darkened Sao Paulo due to heavy rains, promising assistance to businesses and residents who lost power for more than 24 hours.】

item.title: 热带风暴纳丁即将登陆伯利兹
item.description: 美国国家飓风中心称，热带风暴纳丁将于周六在伯利兹登陆，给包括墨西哥尤卡坦半岛在内的整个地区带来洪水暴雨。【原文：Tropical Storm Nadine will come ashore in Belize on Saturday, bringing flooding rains across a region that includes Mexico’s Yucatan Peninsula, the US National Hurricane Center said.】

item.title: 优步（Uber）老板提出强制公司采用电动汽车的理由
item.description:
全球最大的叫车服务公司正试图通过推动各国政府提高电动汽车强制标准来解决碳足迹不断增加的问题。【原文：

The world’s largest ride-hailing service is trying to tackle its rising carbon footprint by pushing governments to increase electric vehicle mandates. 

】

item.title: 英国气象局警告："阿什利风暴 "时速 80 英里的狂风 "可能 "危及生命
item.description: 英国气象局表示，本周末，英国部分地区将迎来本季首场命名风暴，时速 80 英里的狂风可能会造成人员伤亡和生命危险。【原文：Injuries and danger to life are likely during the 80mph winds set to hit parts of the UK this weekend in the first named storm of the season, the Met Office has said.】

item.title: 加州灌木丛大火迫使奥克兰山区居民撤离
item.description: 周五，旧金山湾区的奥克兰山（Oakland Hills）发生了一场灌木丛大火，烧毁了几栋房屋，并在野火形势严峻的情况下引发了人员疏散。【原文：A brush fire that broke out Friday in the San Francisco Bay Area’s Oakland Hills burned several homes and prompted evacuations amid critical wildfire conditions.】

item.title: Hilcorp 因在新墨西哥州排放甲烷被罚款 940 万美元
item.description: 亿万富翁杰夫-希尔德布兰德（Jeff Hildebrand）经营的私营石油生产商希尔科普能源公司（Hilcorp Energy Co.【原文：Hilcorp Energy Co., the privately held oil producer run by billionaire Jeff Hildebrand, will pay a $9.4 million civil penalty for failing to reduce emissions of methane and volatile gases in New Mexico.】

item.title: 阿尔特曼支持的核电股票因人工智能电力需求而身价倍增
item.description: 本周，由于投资者纷纷涌入与电力行业相关的公司，一家由山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）支持的先进核能系统开发商的价值翻了一番多。【原文：A developer of advanced nuclear systems backed by Sam Altman has more than doubled in value this week as investors rushed to pile into companies associated with the power industry.】

item.title: 据称沙特集团将重启 20 亿欧元出售西班牙 Fotowatio 公司的交易
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的阿卜杜勒-拉蒂夫-贾米尔能源与环境服务公司（Abdul Latif Jameel Energy & Environmental Services）计划重启出售 Fotowatio Renewable Ventures 的交易，知情人士称，这笔交易可能会使这家西班牙能源公司的估值达到约 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元）。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Abdul Latif Jameel Energy & Environmental Services plans to revive the sale of Fotowatio Renewable Ventures in a deal that may value the Spanish energy company at about €2 billion ($2.2 billion), people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 美国 "僵尸之夏 "削弱能源需求和天然气价格
item.description: 美国将在 10 月余下的几周内迎来异常温暖的天气，这已经影响了天然气的价格和需求。【原文：The US is headed for weeks of abnormally warm weather through the rest of October, and it’s already shaken prices and demand for natural gas.】

item.title: 南非酝酿巨灾债券和气候保险规则
item.description: 南非国家财政部正在探索制定法规，鼓励使用金融工具应对气候变化，包括巨灾债券和参数保险。【原文：South Africa’s National Treasury is exploring regulations to encourage the use of financial instruments to tackle climate change, including catastrophe bonds and parametric insurance.】

item.title: 为什么千年一遇的洪灾随时可能发生？
item.description: 今天的时事通讯揭示了 1,ooo 年一遇风暴的真正含义，以及为什么它对于传达风险和确保基础设施做好准备如此重要。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需不受限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter demystifies what a 1-in-1,ooo-year storm really means, and why it’s so important to communicating risk and ensuring infrastructure is ready. You can read and share a full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 千年一遇暴雨的真正含义
item.description:
飓风 "海伦 "是上个月袭击北卡罗来纳州的两场千年一遇的风暴之一，这突出表明有必要更清楚地了解极端洪水的风险。【原文：

Hurricane Helene was one of two 1,000-year storms to hit North Carolina last month, underscoring the need for more clearly understanding the risks of extreme deluges.

】

item.title: 阿什维尔的脏水警告老化的美国基础设施面临气候风险
item.description:
飓风海伦（Helene）和米尔顿（Milton）等狂风暴雨以及酷热和干旱有可能使全国的水处理厂不堪重负。【原文：

Fierce storms like Hurricanes Helene and Milton, as well as extreme heat and drought, threaten to overwhelm the nation’s water treatment plants.

】

item.title: 即使获得救助，Northvolt 仍面临重大障碍
item.description: 在获得 3 亿美元的救助后，Northvolt AB 似乎躲过了一场对其生存的重大威胁。然而，这家负债累累的电池制造商的长期前景依然充满变数。【原文：With a $300 million bailout in its sights, Northvolt AB appears to have dodged a major threat to its existence. Yet longer term prospects for the debt-laden battery maker remain fraught.】

item.title: 维诺德-科斯拉（Vinod Khosla）称未来五年内 "融合将成为现实
item.description:
这位亿万富翁投资人认为，这项技术是为人工智能推动的数据中心繁荣脱碳的一种方式。【原文：

The billionaire investor sees the technology as a way to decarbonize the AI-fueled data center boom.

】

item.title: 暴雨淹没家园和农作物，法国继续保持警惕
item.description: 法国仍然对西南部的暴雨和洪水保持警惕，而北部则因强降水而略有缓和，强降水使生活陷入停顿，农作物的收割和播种也受到干扰。【原文：France remains on alert for heavy rain and flooding in the southwest while the north gets a slight reprieve from the intense precipitation that has thrown life out of gear and disrupted crop harvesting and planting.】

item.title: 美国投资 20 亿美元用于电网项目以抵御风暴
item.description: 拜登政府将提供近 20 亿美元资金，帮助美国电网抵御极端天气，并扩大输电项目。【原文：The Biden administration is awarding nearly $2 billion in funding to help steel the US power grid against extreme weather and to expand transmission projects.】

item.title: 莫迪家乡的印度城市考虑发行 2 亿美元绿色债券
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）的家乡古吉拉特邦（Gujarat）的一个城市正在酝酿发行首只绿色市政债券，销售所得将用于资助一系列旨在减少碳排放的项目。【原文：An Indian city in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s home state of Gujarat is mulling its first green muni bond, with proceeds from the sale to be used for funding a range of projects aimed at reducing carbon emissions.】

item.title: 印度研究削减关税以促进绿色氢能发展
item.description: 印度正在考虑削减生产绿色氢气所需机械的进口关税，因为该国正努力成为这种清洁燃料的主要中心。【原文：India is considering cuts to tariffs on imports of machinery needed to manufacture green hydrogen, as the nation pushes to become a major hub for the cleaner fuel.】

item.title: 欧盟的 "绿色转变 "受到威胁，消费者受到切实打击
item.description: 欧盟在五年前推出了 "绿色协议"，目标是使其成为欧盟增长的基石，并为世界制定议程。现在，分歧已经取代了大张旗鼓的宣传，清洁工业时代的领导权有可能拱手让给美国和中国。【原文：The European Union unveiled its Green Deal five years ago with the goal of making it the cornerstone of the bloc’s growth and setting the agenda for the world. Fault lines have now replaced fanfare, and risk handing leadership of the clean industrial era to the US and China.】
